loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and the father of four children. Hasan is the family's sole provider.

Hasan owns a small garage where he fixes minor car problems but specializes in changing and selling both engines oil and tires. He established his business in 1998 and since then he has been growing in fame and experience. Hasan now has an employee and is well-known in the neighborhood thanks to his special services.

Hasan is requesting a loan of $2,400. The aim of this loan is to buy a piece of specialized equipment for his work. Hasan is aiming to expand his business and someday open a bigger garage and provide more services to his neighborhood and also to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of specialized equipment for his work

loans.name: Makara

texts.en:
Makara, age 31, stays at home and takes care of her child. She lives in a Phnom Penh suburb and has one young daughter.

The main source of income is her husband’s salary. He is a security guard. 

She wants to attend a wedding planning and decoration class so she can earn an income to better support her standard of living once she completes the course. Hence Makara has decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to pay the fee for a wedding planning and decoration course.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la ciudad mencionada, ella tiene 35 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes y otras cosas más por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz y otras cosas pues le conviene comprar por mayor para abaratar los costos de compra en consecuencia aumentar el capital del negocio, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
 
Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Alejandrina was born in the city of Paucartambo and lives with her family in the aforementioned city.  She is 35 years old and she lives in a common law marriage from which she has six children.  She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who is getting ahead with her family through her work efforts.  Her economic activity is the sale of food items such as rice, sugar and noodles as well as detergents and other things.  

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy merchandise such as sacks of sugar, sacks of rice and other things as it is best for her to buy wholesale in order to reduce purchasing costs and as a result increase business capital.  She is grateful to those who are part of this dream by means of this method.   She values the loan and she is committed to making her monthly payments very responsibly.  

She belongs to the communal bank "San Martincito" of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Las Cañas Group

texts.es:
Doña Luz, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos en el municipio de Sulaco, Yoro.  Ella se dedica a la elaboración de pan desde hace 10 años. Elabora pan de leche, semitas, quesadillas y otros. También compra, cría y vende pollos y carne de pollo. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo en forma grupal para comprar materiales como harina, azúcar, leche, manteca, huevos para hacer pan. Su objetivo es lograr crecer con su panadería y ampliar su mercado. 
Pertenece al grupo Las cañas, que esta formado por tres miembros, en la foto se identifican de la siguiente manera. A la izquierda esta Roberto, en medio esta Luz, y a la derecha de sombrero esta Ramón. Todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la cría y venta de pollos y a la venta de pan. El préstamo que solicitan es por 5,000 cada uno haciendo un total de 15,000 lempiras, para comprar pollitos para engorde y vender.
texts.en:
Luz is 34 years old and a single mother to three children with whom she lives in the municipality of Sulaco, Yoro.  She has been baking bread for the last ten years, including sweet rolls, semitas and quesadillas, amongst others. She also buys, raises and resells chickens as well as chicken meat. She is applying for a loan as part of a group to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, butter and eggs to make bread. Her goal is to expand her bakery and increase her sales. 

Luz belongs to the Las Cañas group which is made up of three members pictured in the photo: Roberto is on the left, Luz is in the middle and Ramon is wearing a hat on the right. They all live in the same community selling bread and raising and selling chickens. They are applying for a loan of 5,000 each, making a total of 15,000 lempiras, which they will use to buy chicks to fatten up and resell.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise, fatten up and resell

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
Gabina nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la ciudad mencionada, ella tiene 57 años de edad y es casada pero tiene seis hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de chicha por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, jora, harina, cerveza y otras cosas mas, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Gabina was born in the city of Paucartambo where she and her family live. Gabina is 57 years old and married with six children. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who works hard to help her family get ahead. She makes a living selling chicha (a Peruvian purple corn drink). For this reason, she is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as sugar, corn used to make chicha, beer, and other items. Gabina is very grateful for everyone who has a part in this dream of hers. She values this loan and pledges to be very responsible and make her monthly repayments punctually. 

Gabina belongs to the communal bank “San Martincito” from the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy supplies: sugar, corn used to make chicha, flour, beer, and others.

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.es:
Nicasio nació en la ciudad de Acomayo y vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, él tiene 49 años de edad y es separado de su pareja pero tiene una buena relación con sus dos hijos, él es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a sus hijos con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de ollas, frazadas, colchones y artefactos por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ollas, frazadas y otras cosas más, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Marticito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Nicasio was born in Acomayo and now lives in Paucartambo. He is 49 years old and is separated from his partner but has a good relationship with his two children. He is a hardworking and enterprising father who is bringing up his children through his efforts selling pots, blankets, mattresses and artifacts for a living. 

He would like to take this opportunity to apply for a loan to purchase pots, blankets and other things. He is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium. He values this loan and promises to meet his monthly repayments very responsibly. 

Nicasio is part of the San Marticito community bank at the Arariwa Association in Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy pots, blankets and other things

loans.name: Karina Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Karina, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 3  años de edad. Su esposo es profesor de tenis y educación física. 

Doña Karina para ganar algo propio y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de damas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual sale dos o tres días por semana a recorrer por toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, trabaja todos los días ya que también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior para damas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 3 ciclos  y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa con todas las comodidades.
texts.en:
The "1 De Agosto" communal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Montecristi. It is known for it's rich pre-colonial culture and it's handicrafts which are recognized at both the national and international levels. This is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Karina, 23 years old, lives here. She is married and has a 3 year old son from the relationship. Her husband is s tennis and physical education teacher. 


Karina, in order to make her own money and to be able to help out with the general household expenses sells woman`s underwear. She goes door to door selling a few days each week and covers the whole city. She works every day as she also sells from her home to people who know her. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil when she needs to.  She has been doing this for two years and it is going well for her. 

She will use this loan to purchase woman`s underwear. She has been a member of the communal bank for 3 cycles and she likes it as the loans allow her to expand her business. Her dream is to have her own home complete with all the conveniences.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear.

loans.name: Cecilia Leonor

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es gasfitero.

Doña Cecilia es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto sentirse útil e independiente se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar, edredones y productos Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella también en su casa tiene una piscina que los fines de semana es muy concurrida y por la cual cobra la entrada y a los clientes les vende alimentos como ceviches, pescado con chifles entre otros alimentos. Para vender sus productos ella sale a recorrer por la localidad, deja  a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayudo a sacara adelante a sus hijos.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y víveres. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan  los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener un carro para ir a entregar sus productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “1 De Agosto” [August 1] meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. Montecristi is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisanal products, which are recognized both nationally and internationally. It is also home of the famous Panama or toquilla straw hats.

Cecilia is 45 years old and lives in Montecristi. She is married and has three children who are all now adults and independent. Her husband is a plumber.

Cecilia is a housewife who also sells items for the home, duvets and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories). She says that her business provides her with her own resources and makes her feel useful and independent. Cecilia also has a pool in her home, which is very busy on weekends and for which she charges an entrance fee. To her pool customers she sells food such as ceviche [raw fish marinated in lemon juice] or fish with fried plantains. To sell her products, she goes from door to door in her area, selling on credit and collecting payments every eight days. She has now been working at this business for over 20 years, and she says that it helped provide for her children.

Cecilia is requesting this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and food supplies. She has been in the communal bank for five years, and she says she likes it because the loans have helped her. She says that her dream is to have a car to use to deliver her products.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and food supplies.

loans.name: Margarita Nancy

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Margarita, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y 13  años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es taxista. 

Doña Margarita para obtener sus recursos y con esto ayudar a sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la preparación y distribución de helado caseros, todos los días ella prepara helados de varios sabores los mismos que luego sale a entregar en varias tiendas y colegios de la localidad, lugares que le piden sus helados por lo deliciosos que son y con esto tienen mucha salida y ellos también obtienen ganancias. Trabaja todos los días, desde las 5h00  hasta la noche ya sea en la preparación o en la entrega de sus helados, lleva mas de 3 años en este negocio el cual le permite ganar sus recursos los cuales emplea en la educación de sus hijos que es lo más importante para ella.

Este crédito lo van a utilizar en comprar azúcar, saborizantes, leche y frutas para preparar sus deliciosos helados. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener una fábrica de helados con más infraestructura.
texts.en:
The communal bank group "1st of August" meets every two weeks in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and its handicrafts which are nationally and internationally renowned. The famous Panama hats are made here.

Margarita, 36 years old, lives in Montecristi. She is married and has two children ages 14 and 13; both are in high school. Her husband is a taxi driver. In order to earn money and help her family get ahead, Margarita produces and distributes homemade ice cream. Each day, she makes ice cream in various flavors to deliver to different stores and high schools in her area. These sites order her ice cream to stock because it is so delicious. In this way, both she and they profit from this business. Margarita works every day starting at 5 a.m. and into the night, preparing and delivering her ice creams. She has been working in this business for three years. It has allowed her to earn her own money to pay for her children's education, which is the most important thing to her. 

Margarita will use this loan to buy sugar, flavorings, milk, and fruit to make her delicious ice creams. This is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank. She likes this group because of the great help they provide with the loans. Margarita's dream is to have an ice cream factory with more infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flavoring, milk, and fruit.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea nació en el distrito de Challabamba de la Provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en el distrito antes mencionada, ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de ropa por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo casacas, chompas, pantalones, buzos y otras cosas, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Timotea was born in the district of Challabamba in the province of Paucartambo, which is also where she now lives with her family. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children. She is a hardworking mother and entrepreneur who provides for her family with her hard work. She works selling clothing.

Timotea is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as jackets, sweaters, pants, tracksuits and others. She says that she is grateful to all those who are a part of her dream through this loan. She also says that she appreciates the loan and promises to responsibly make her monthly payments.

Timotea belongs to the field partner's communal bank “San Martincito” in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as jackets, sweaters, pants, tracksuits and others.

loans.name: Basanoy

texts.en: Basanoy is married and has five children. Two of them are adults and three of them are not yet adults. She always wanted to provide her family with good living conditions. She works at the school as a teacher and has a small salary. She aimed to organize a business and to find a new source of income. With this aim, she studied the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and gained business skills.  Her children will help her with her business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy cattle to start a new business. She will get through by using the loan and her business will become a source of income so her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for her new business

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de  15, 14, 12 y 2 años  de edad, los tres mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es obrero.

Doña María es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a solventar los gastos que generan el hogar y la educación de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de productos Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja de tres a cuatro días a la semana sobre todo por las mañanas cuando sus hijos están en el colegio, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva 2  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien,  lo que más vende son los perfumes.	

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y accesorios para damas. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante. 

Sus sueños son seguir creciendo en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The “1 de Agosto” (1st of August) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are recognized at a national and international level.  It is the place of the famous straw hats.

María lives here.  She is 30 years old and lives in a common-law marriage and from this relationship they have 4 children who are 15, 14, 12 and 2 years old.  The three older students attend school.  Her husband is a laborer.

María is a homemaker who, in order to obtain her own resources and with these help to cover the expenses that her household generates and the education of her children, works selling Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies’ accessories).  Her method of sales is door to door.  She works three to four days a week especially in the mornings when her children are in school.  She leaves her products on credit and collects every 8 days.  She has been working in this activity for 2 years and it is going very well for her.  What she sells the most are the perfumes. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and ladies’ accessories.  She has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because the loans help her very much to get ahead.

Her dream is to continue growing in her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and ladies’ accessories.

loans.name: Gwlala

texts.en:
Gwlala is a 43-year-old, married Iraqi woman. She has two children. To help her husband improve their family's income, she opened a beauty shop in 2005, providing hairstyling, cuts and coloring, face massage, makeup and beauty care. Gwlala has two employees. To continue providing excellent service and to attract additional customers, she decided to upgrade her business.

Gwlala is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to buy a massage machine, chair, air conditioner and water cooler. She is aiming to increase her profits, which offers her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

The story of Gwlala and her business is just one of many examples of IED’s clients who have been able to improve their businesses with a small business loan product specifically designed to meet the needs of small businesses, where relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy a massage machine, chair, air conditioner and water cooler.

loans.name: Mahmadgolib

texts.en: Mahmadgolib is 45 years old and married with one son.  He works as a director and is a hardworking, honest man.  His only son has graduated and will attend university this year.  He entered the National University of Tajikistan and will study finance and credit.  His son is smart and makes Mahmadgolib proud.  Mahmadgolib is asking for a loan to pay for his son’s tuition.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s university tuition.

loans.name: Sreypheap's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Chheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Sreypheap is a 32-year-old married mother of two children who are dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 12 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about 28,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 14,000KHR each day for future needs.

Sreypheap’s group is with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Manora

texts.en:
Manora is a young, smart, 18-year-old woman.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  She was one of the best pupils in school.  She studied very well and took part in many competitions.  

Now, Manora is a university student of the first course.  She hopes that she will also study well in the university.  Unfortunately, she does not have money to pay tuition.  Her parents are also unable to support her as they earn a small income.  She requests a loan to help pay for her tuition.  Manora awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Imomaly

texts.ru: Имомали родился в 1994 года. Он молодой и энергичный парень. Имомали с детства был трудолюбивым и целеустремленным. Он хорошо учился в средней школе и с отличием окончил. После окончания средней школы он поступил в университет, так как с детства он мечтал стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Имомали должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Его родители простые рабочие и имеют маленький доход. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Имомали запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора.
texts.en: Imomaly was born in 1994. He is an energetic young man. From his childhood he has been hard-working and goal-oriented. He was a good student in secondary school and earned excellent grades on his high school diploma. After finishing secondary school, he was admitted to the university as he has always been dreaming of becoming a highly qualified professional. Imomaly needs to pay for his tuition but lacks the necessary funds. His parents are simple workers with a limited income. Imomaly is single and lives with his parents. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,100 USD in order to pay for his university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for tuition at the university.

loans.name: Zarah

texts.en:
This is Zarah. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her income from her business assisted in her children's education and their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband, who works as a stock man, are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Zarah hopes that her business will flourish and she dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
This is Alfredo, 27, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Ronalyn, an employee, and they have one child. He and his wife manage their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Alfredo has a business raising poultry. He earns income by selling live chickens to meat dealers. Sometimes he has the chickens slaughtered and sold in the market. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help him continue the operations of his business, Alfredo is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy feeds and additional poultry.

Alfredo dreams that his business will continue to expand and of having a vehicle. He hopes that his child will finish his studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. This is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more poultry and feeds for his business.

loans.name: Soom Be Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mme T.CELINE représente le groupe SOM BE WENDE.  Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 02 vont  à l’école.
Mme est restauratrice  depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Kilwin. Ses clients sont les  gens du quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 02 cartons de poisson, 04 sachets d’atiéké (couscous de manioc) et 01bidon d’huile de 20l.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle désire épargne afin de pouvoir vendre de l’eau et de la boisson. Mme ambitionne  agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Celine represents the Som Be Wende group. She is doing well. She is married, with five children. The oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Two of her children go to school.
T. Celine has been cooking food for sale for eight years. She stocks up at a market in Kilwin. Her customers are local residents. She would like to buy two cartons of fish, five packets of atiéké (cassava couscous) and one 20-liter [5-gallon] jug of vegetable oil.
With her earnings she would like to grow her savings in order to start selling [drinking] water and beverages. Her goal is to expand her business and improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fish, five packets of atiéké (cassava couscous) and one 20-liter  jug of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Kean's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Kean is 35 years old and married.  She has three children, all of whom are dependents that are still in school.  To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice for 16 years.  The current business earns her family about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Kean has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles.  She has successfully used the past loan to better support her family.  It helped her to have sufficient food and to support her children’s education.  Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland.  With this loan, she hopes to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 29-year-old married woman applying for a $1,000 loan to improve her business.  She opened her repair shop in 2000 with her own working capital of $70 and has been doing business for the past 12 years.  She earns a good income from her business and is a very hardworking woman.

She will use her loan to buy a hog, motorcycle tire tool, and a tire.  She wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy a hog, motorcycle tire tool, and tire.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Sopha is 43 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has two dependent children to take care of. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income and she and her husband have been in this business for 22 years. Her husband helps to earn additional income by working for others for a fee. With the current business, she can earn approximately 24,000 KHR per day and save about 13,000 KHR each day for their future needs.
 
This is the first micro loan for Sopha’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sopha will use her portion to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to have a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en: Musrat is a 43-year-old energetic woman. She has five children and her husband is a government employee. She has been running a cosmetics and undergarments shop for five years. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. Currently, she has a limited stock to offer her customers. She would use the loan to purchase a new variety of cosmetics and undergarments, and in this way, her sales would increase. This loan could help her to increase her monthly income and savings for the better future of her children. Musrat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of cosmetics and undergarments to sell

loans.name: Ngoern's Group

texts.en:
Ngoern, 54, lives in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. She is married and has five children. For the last 35 years, Ngoern has been growing rice and cassava to make a living. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.
 
Ngoern has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she completely repaid the loan. She used the past loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to have a bugger crop yield from her farmland in order to have a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Roin

texts.en:
Roin is 35 years old and lives in the Khelvachauri district with his wife, four-year-old daughter, brother and mother. Roin’s mother has chronic health problems and gets a small assistance from the local government. His brother works as a distributor. The family is involved in an agricultural business and runs a dairy farm with a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. They also own a citrus garden. Roin always has quality agricultural products and sells them in his district.

Roin owns a flat in the littoral (coastal) city of Batumi. He managed to save and renovate it to rent it to others, but the family's income was not enough to buy furniture. With the start-up credit, Roin will purchase furniture and comfortably organize the flat. Summertime is high season in Batumi and it’s full of holiday makers, so Roin will rent the flat easily, especially in summer.
 
The new business initiative will give Roin a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to buy furniture for the flat he rents to others

loans.name: Mohruhsor

texts.en: Mohruhsor is a single, 17-year-old girl who lives with her parents.  She studied very well in school and was one of the best pupils.  Mohruhsor always wanted to attend higher education.  She took her document to Tajik Technical University where she passed the exam.  Mohruhsor is now a student of the first course.  She is requesting a loan to pay for her education at the university.  She has a dream of becoming a specialist and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Jonni Vicente

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive el señor Jonni, tiene 46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos 17, 15, 13 y 12 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en universidad y  los tres menores en colegio.  Su mujer trabaja en una fábrica de atún. 

Don Jonni es un hombre muy trabajador que a punta de esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su mujer sale adelante, el trabaja de despachador en una gasolinera en la localidad pero en su casa tiene un pequeño negocio, tiene unas mesas de billar en el cual todas las noches  llegan muchas personas a distraerse, allí el también vende aguas, colas, jugos y varios bocaditos de picar, esto le deja un ingreso extra ya que con lo que ganan los dos en sus trabajos no les alcanza para suplir los gastos del hogar y más aun los estudios de sus hijos que son muchos. 

Este crédito es para comprar aguas, sodas, jugos, golosinas entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta con los créditos el surte aun mas su negocio. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: The 1 De Agosto (August 1st) Community Bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts that are recognized on a national and international level, including its famous straw hats. It is here we find Jonni, who is 46 years old and has four children, ages 17, 15, 13 and 12, with his common-law wife. The eldest is in college, and the youngest three are in school. His wife works at a tuna factory. Jonni is a hardworking man who thanks to his efforts and his wife's help is able to make headway. He works at a local gas station but he also runs a small business out of his home. He has some pool tables, and at night many people come to play. He also sells water, sodas, juices and different sandwiches to earn extra income, since what he and his wife make on their own isn't enough to pay the bills or even cover their children's education expenses, which are costly. With the loan, he plans to purchase water, sodas, juices, snacks and other items to sell. He has been with the community bank for five years and likes the loans so he can better stock his business. His dream is for his children to become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase water, soda, juices, snacks and other items.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is a 31-year-old married man who lives with his 28-year-old wife and 2-year-old daughter in Khoni district.  Nowadays, the family is without a source of income.  There is a high unemployment rate in the region but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.  So, Shota decided to start his own business with a loan.  Unfortunately, the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  As a result of not satisfying these requirements, his credit requests were rejected several times.  

Shota received the credit in the framework of a start-up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  This program enables the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  With a credit of $3,500, Shota will purchase tires for his truck.  Once tires are purchased, he will be able to work in transportation and generate income.  It is obvious that the job is hard, as he will sometimes need to drive long distances.  But he is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop his business gradually.

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased.  Shota thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his truck.

loans.name: Judit

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Judit to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2006 with her own working capital.  She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her store, such as gasoline and coconut oil.  She is generating a good income from selling.

Judit has been thinking of running a big business after years of doing business.  She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and coconut oil.

loans.name: Ermitanio

texts.es:
Hermitanio nació en la distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo y vive en el distrito antes mencionado, él tiene 21 años de edad y es soltero y aun no tiene hijos, él es un joven trabajador y emprendedor que sale adelante con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la construcción de casas, pistas, obras y otras cosas más por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil para hacer planos, informes  y otras cosas más, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Hermitanio was born in the district of Colquepata, province of Paucartambo and still lives there. He is 21 years old, single and has no children. He is a hardworking and enterprising young man who strives to make headway. He makes a living building homes and other structures, and at this time is requesting a loan to purchase a laptop computer to make blueprints, reports and other items. He thanks those who are helping fulfill his dreams through this loan, and he promises to make his payments responsibly. He belongs to the "San Martincito" Community Bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer to make blueprints, reports and other things.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo de la Provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la ciudad antes mencionada, ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de comestibles por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo detergentes, arroz, azúcar, pan, gaseosas y otras cosas, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Marisol was born in the city of Paucartambo, province of Paucartambo and still lives there with her family. She is 32 years old and married, and from this beautiful relationship has four children. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who strives to make headway for her family. She makes a living selling groceries and at this time is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise like detergents, rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks and other items. She thanks those who are helping fulfill this dream, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She belongs to the "San Martincito" Community Bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like detergents, rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
Evelia es soltera y vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa Armonia de la ciudad de La Paz. Es empleada en una institución en la cual trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día. Es ingeniera agrónoma y requiere el préstamo para un curso de especialización dentro del área de su carrera.

El sueño de Evelia es terminar de estudiar y poder acceder a un mejor empleo con lo que podría en un futuro tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Evelia is single and lives in a rental property in the District of Villa Armonia in the city of La Paz. She is employed at an institution where she works more than eight hours a day. Evelia is an agricultural engineer and needs this loan for a specialization course in an area related to her degree.

Evelia’s dream is to finish her studies and obtain a better job so that she can have a house of her own in the future.

loans.use: to pay for a specialization course related to her degree.

loans.name: Enrique Porfirio

texts.es:
Enrique nació en la provincia de Paucartambo, él tiene 43 años de edad y es una persona  trabajadora y responsable que sale adelante con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de ceviche por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo limónes, pescados, sal, cebollas, lechugas y otras cosas más, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Enrique is a native of Paucartambo province. He is 43 years old, and is a responsible person who has made headway through hard work. He makes a living selling ceviche and at this time is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients like limes, fish, salt, onions, lettuce and other items. He thanks those who play a part in this dream, and he promises to be very responsible with his payments. He belongs to "San Martincito" Community Bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to purchase limes, fish, salt, onions, lettuce and other ingredients.

loans.name: Amada Brudulbudura

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Durán.  Empezó tiempo atrás luego de la separación de su esposo, dado que tuvo la necesidad de poner un negocio para poder tener un ingreso económico.  Trabaja sola desde las 7 am hasta las 11 pm.  Es soltera y no tiene hijos.  Desea poder incrementar su negocio de manera significativa en un futuro cercano.  Por ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Durán. She began her business some time ago and later separated from her husband. She needed to establish her business so that she could have an income. The borrower works alone from 7:00 A.M. to 11:00 P.M. She is single and has no children. She wants to increase her business significantly in the near future.

For now, she needs a loan so that she can buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Fernando José

texts.es:
Don Fernando José habita en el bello municipio de El Sauce donde abunda la leche y miel por sus actividades.
Tiene veinte años de dedicarse a labor de maestro y como padre responsable ha tratado de darle un hogar digno a sus tres hijos así como buena educación.
Uno de sus más grandes sueños es ver preparados profesionalmente a sus hijos para que el día de mañana tengan una herramienta para defenderse en la vida, ya que es la mejor herencia que él y su esposa le pueden dejar.
Actualmente se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel con el fin de obtener un crédito de los inversionistas Kiva para pagar los gastos universitarios de sus tres hijos para que esto no sea un obstáculo para que culmine su carrera, debido a que con el bajo salario que gana no puede cubrir estos elevados gastos.
Les agradece de corazón a estas personas que apoyan al más necesitado como es su caso porque todos los créditos que ha obtenido le han servido para pagar la universidad de sus hijos los que en futuro serán profesionales.
texts.en:
Fernando José lives in the beautiful municipality of El Sauce where the milk and honey flow thanks to its businesses.

He has been a teacher for twenty years and as a responsible father he has tried to provide his three children with a decent home and a good education. 

One of his greatest dreams is to see his children become professionals so that in the future they will have a tool with which to defend themselves in life, which is the best inheritance he and his wife could leave them.  

He is currently applying to Ceprodel for a Kiva loan to pay for his three children's university fees so that this will not be an obstacle to their finishing their degrees.  He is not able to cover these high costs with his small salary.

He gives heartfelt thanks to the people who help those in the greatest need, such as himself, because all of the loans he has received have helped him pay for his children to go to college so they can be professionals in the future.

loans.use: to pay for university fees

loans.name: Jilber Emilio

texts.es:
Jilber Emilio es un joven de 36 años, padre de familia de dos niños, originario del municipio de El Sauce ubicado al occidente de León.
Se desempeña como operador de un pozo de agua potable donde tiene más de diez años de dedicarse a esta labor, quien se encarga de suministrar el agua a toda la población de dicho municipio.
Gracias a este trabajo le permite dar el sustento a sus dos hijos quienes son lo más importante en su vida y desea cada día darle lo mejor.
En este momento desea reparar su motocicleta ya que es su machete de trabajo por lo que debido a la actividad que realiza debe movilizarse en su vehículo además por la distancia, por tal motivo está solicitando un crédito a los inversionistas Kiva a través de Ceprodel para comprar repuestos para su motocicleta, con el fin de mejorar la condiciones de la misma.
Confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Jilber Emilio is a young man of 36, the father of two children, and a native of the municipality of El Sauce in western León. 

He works as an operator at a drinking water well where he has over ten years of experience with this work, which is responsible for providing the municipality's entire population with water.  

Thanks to this work he is able to support his two children, who are the most important thing in his life and whom he wants to give the best to every day.

He currently wants to repair his motorcycle as it is the work horse he needs to get around for his job, which is far away.  For this reason, he is asking Kiva's lenders for a loan through Ceprodel to buy parts for his motorcycle so he can get it in better shape.

He believes in God that good-hearted people will respond to his request so he can make his investment.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Grisel Geovanny

texts.es:
Grisel Geovany es una joven de 31 años, que habita al occidente del departamento de León, en un poblado alejado del bullicio de la ciudad llamado Sauce debido a la abundancia de este árbol que es el símbolo de su nombre.
Esta joven se desempeña como trabajadora social en un organismo donde ejerce obras sociales a la comunidad.
Grisel es casada madre de una pequeña niña a la que le da todo su amor porque es lo más preciado que tiene en la vida.
Está solicitando un crédito a los inversionistas Kiva a través de Ceprodel para apoyar a su esposo y comprar mobiliario y productos para la barbería que es su principal negocio con el fin de atraer al cliente y brindar un buen servicio.
Espera que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión, ya que los créditos son primordiales porque en Nicaragua apenas alcanza para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Grisel Geovanny is a young woman of 31 who lives in western León in a town far from the bustle of the city of Sauce, which is named after the tree that is its symbol. 

This young woman is a social worker for an organization that carries out social projects in the community.

Grisel is married and the mother of a little girl to whom she gives all of her love because she is the most precious thing she has in life.

She is asking Kiva's lenders for a loan through Ceprodel to help her husband buy a display case and barber products as this is his main business and he wants to attract customers and offer quality service.

She hopes that good-hearted people will respond to her request so she can make this investment as these loans are essential because there is barely enough to live on in Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy a display case and barber products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a quinceañera dress, cards, mementos, and transportation

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina, de 31 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Emilio y de su pequeño hijo en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, y en la actualidad  siembra alverja junto a su esposo; aunque dice que la labor es algo sacrificada, pues debe madrugar todos los días para vigilar con dedicación sus cultivos. Pero le alienta saber que, la recompensa a todo su esfuerzo es la buena cosecha que obtiene cuando su producción de alverja esta lista para ser recogida. Es ahí que contrata la ayuda de trabajadores que lo apoyan en alistar  los pesados sacos para comercializarlos a los vendedores mayoristas de la ciudad. Las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de sus productos naturales son regulares, es por esta razón que puede ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como la labor agrícola le parece un negocio rentable, tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias, además quiere comprar ganado porcino y empezar con la comercialización de estos animales. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelanta en su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Delfina, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Delfina, age 31, lives in her own home with her husband Emilio and their young son. She has worked in agriculture from a very young age and is currently growing peas with her husband. Delfina says that the work requires some sacrifices. She must get up at dawn every day so that she can look after her crops with dedication. However, she is encouraged when she is rewarded for all of her efforts with a bountiful harvest as soon as the peas are ready to be picked. During that time, she hires workers to carry the heavy sacks that will be sold to the wholesale vendors in the city. The profits she earns from the sale of her natural products are average, which explains why she is able to provide her family with a good quality of life. Since farming can be a profitable business, she plans to plant more crops so that she can improve her earnings. In addition, she wants to buy pigs so that she can begin selling these animals.

This is Delfina’s fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful to know that she has the financial support that will allow her to continue her business. In addition, she promises to submit her loan payments in a punctual manner. She will invest 3,000 PEN in the purchase of organic fertilizer so that she can nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 35 years old and lives in the littoral city of Batumi with her husband and sons. Her elder son is a school-leaver and plans to enter the high school. Natia had a higher education but she’s unemployed at the moment and stays home.

The only source of income for the family is the $240 USD salary earned by Natia’s husband working as a guide at the tourist agency. Natia has newly purchased a flat in the city center. She managed to make savings and renovate it for renting out, but her income was not enough to buy furniture and home appliances. With the start-up credit, Natia will purchase those items and comfortably organize the flat. Summertime is high season in Batumi and it’s full of holiday makers, so Natia will rent the flat easily, especially in summer. With this determination and her loan, she expects to improve her income and give her son a university education. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and home appliances for her flat for renting it out.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is a 25-year-old single man, living in the village of Gonio with his parents, brother and sister-in-law. All of the family members are unemployed. Zaza used to work as a party singer and got special orders, but now his musical instruments are rented out and that is the only source of income for the family.

As their current income is too small and Zaza can’t find a job, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Zaza applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved within the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses.  

A loan of $3,000 will help Zaza to purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them in return for a service fee. Zaza is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to get ahead.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Zaza is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car for starting a taxi business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina lives in Gurjaani District. She is 55 years old, and lives with her husband, George. Marina works as a cleaner at the village school and gets a small monthly income (approximately $50 per month). George is a miller and receives a modest salary as well. 

As their income is not enough for covering everyday expenses, and their living conditions are very poor, Marina and George decided to start their business, but found that they didn’t have enough money to do so. Marina’s loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

Marina will use the loan to purchase a secondhand car, and her husband will serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car for her husband to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 57 years old, married and has two children. 

Perlita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Perlita has been raising pigs for 25 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Perlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque is a 33-year-old married man, and a father of two children aged 9 and 8. Roque lives with his family in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. 

Roque has been in the farming business for more than eight years now. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, which will help improve his yield and income. 

In the future, Roque hopes to expand his farming venture and makes it a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Rosela requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

In the future, Rosela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 36 years old, married and lives with his wife, two children, sister-in-law and mother-in-law. Levan works as a painter and his wife is a hair stylist at the beauty salon. Both of them get monthly salaries. Their total amount of monthly income is $360, which is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses. 

There is a high unemployment rate in the region and Levan is unable to find a suitable and well-paying job. That is why he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Levan applied for a loan from MFO Credo. His request was approved within the framework of their Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses.  

A loan of $1,700 will help Levan to purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them in return for a service fee. Levan is very enthusiastic and is a hard working person with a great desire to get ahead. This credit will be a great support for the family. Levan is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is 32 years old. He is married and lives in the Samtredia district with his wife, daughter, father, brother, sister-in-law, niece and grandmother. The family runs an agricultural business. They own eight milking cows, and produce cheese with their milk, which is then sold locally. In addition, Ivane cultivates agricultural land where maize is grown. However, their existing income is not enough to cover the costs for the eight-member family.

Ivane has made multiple loan requests, without success, from the local financial institutions in order to start up a trading business. His loan requests were rejected each time due to low income. Now, Ivane’s loan request has been approved as part of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with loans with soft conditions. Borrowers are the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as ‘high-risk borrowers’ because of their low income. 

With the loan, Ivane will purchase merchandise and set up a general store. He will purchase a variety of household and daily consumer products and sell them from his store. He has already chosen commercial space, which has a crowded location. Ivane hopes his project will be profitable and generate income. Ivane will work hard, and he will be able to save for house renovations.

loans.use: to start up a general store in his district.

loans.name: Chehronbek

texts.en:
Chehronbek is 19 years old. He is a hardworking and clever boy. Chehronbek is single and lives with his parents. He graduated from school last year and has entered the National University of Tajikistan. His studies at the university are going well. He is one of the best students. Chehronbek has many friends and all of them love him because he is a good boy. 

Chehronbek must pay for his tuition at the university, however he has no money. He is requesting a loan to pay for his education fees at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition at university.

loans.name: Zibulatudde Development Group

texts.en:
John is pictured wearing a yellow t-shirt with black stripes. He grows and sells passionfruit to earn a living. He works 7 days a week for 10 hours each day. He is also involved in farming for another source of income, and he has been in this business for three years. John began his business to acquire some income to support his family.

With his portion of the loan, John would like to buy more passionfruit. He will buy mulch for the passionfruit and also restock some of the passionfruit plants to increase his sales. It is the hot season so the mulch will help to maintain the moisture in the soil. He hopes that the loan will help him to take his business to another level.

John's main challenges are diseases and poor transport. He is hard working, resilient, honest and dependable.

The tenth person, pictured on the extreme right, is the group chairperson who signed the waiver form and is not listed on this group.

loans.use: to buy mulch and more passionfruit plants to increase his stock.

loans.name: Goderdzi

texts.en:
Goderdzi is 34 years old. He is single and lives in the Terjola district with his parents. Goderdzi is unemployed at the moment and the only source of income for the family is a small salary earned by Goderdzi’s father, who works as an artisan in spite of his chronic health problems.

However, his father's earnings are not enough to cover the cost of food and everyday expenses. For this reason, Goderdzi decided to start a dairy farm. Goderdzi's loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans with reasonable terms to start-up businesses. These loans are provided to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low incomes. 

The loan will be used to purchase a milking cow. Goderdzi will house the cow in the cattle shed located in his yard, and he will sell the milk at the local market. He estimates that the family's income will increase by 150 to 200 GEL, which is a 40 to 50 percent increase. The family's living conditions will significantly improve, enabling them to access regular credit products that are currently available.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow to start a dairy farm.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of twelve children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Teresita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Datuna

texts.en:
Datuna is 41 years old. He lives in the Khashuri District with his mother, wife and an infant child. Datuna’s mother is retired and gets a monthly pension. Datuna runs a small scale agricultural business and grows grapes, maize and beans on his own plot of land. The harvest is sold at the local open market. In addition, Datuna is a builder and works on orders from time to time. However, his income is not enough for the family and they live in poverty. They receive a small social assistance benefit from the government. 

Datuna has requested a loan to start a dairy farm. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans with reasonable terms to start-up businesses. These loans are provided to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low incomes. 

The loan will be used for purchasing a milking cow. Datuna will house the cow in the cattle shed located in his yard, and will start selling the milk at the local market. The family's income will increase by 150–200 GEL (Georgian Lari), which is a 40 to 50 percent increase. The family's living conditions will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow and start a dairy business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been involved in for ten years.

She has requested a loan of PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other fishing gear for her business.

Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other fishing gear for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 65 years old, married and has three children. She operates a business raising livestock in the Philippines. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock. Teresita has been raising livestock for 11 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is 28 years old, single, and lives in the Akhaltsikhe district with his parents. Arsen is a lawyer but he is unemployed at the moment. His father is the only one who makes money in the household. He owns a hotel and earns a monthly income. 

Arsen is a very enthusiastic young man and wishes to be financially independent. He decided to start his own business with the help of a loan. Arsen requested a loan from MFO Credo and the application was approved within the framework of a startup program that enables inexperienced borrowers to begin new businesses. Arsen owns a commercial space, and with the loan received, he will purchase essential equipment such as a vacuum cleaner, hoses and power washers. He will provide services to local community members and hopes to generate income. 

The new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family and give Arsen finance stability. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up a car wash.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra es soltera y vive en casa de su abuela en la ciudad de La Paz. Ella estudia gastronomía y ademas dispone de un espacio en casa de su abuela que lo usa para organizar fiestas infantiles y así poder cubrir con sus gastos diarios y de estudios. Alexandra requiere el crédito para poder comprar mas juegos infantiles y poder ampliar su negocio.

El sueñode Alexandra es terminar su carrera y poder independizarse.
texts.en:
Alexandra is single and lives at her grandmother’s house in the city of La Paz. She is studying gastronomy and also has a space set aside in her grandmother’s house for organizing children’s parties. This enables her to cover her daily expenses and the cost of her studies. Alexandra is requesting a loan so that she can buy more children’s games and expand her business.

Her dream is to finish her degree and become independent.

loans.use: to buy more children's games and expand her business.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 54 years old and married with seven children. With two children currently in school, Vivencia works very hard to provide for them.

Vivencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Vivencia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as bread, shampoo, soy sauce, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, salt, etc. 

Vivencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her motorbike.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en: Gulnoza is 18 years old. She is a hardworking and clever young woman. She graduated school with good and excellent marks. She likes math, English, geography, etc. She also helps her mother with housing. Gulnoza entered Technical University of Tajikistan. She will study in the capital of Tajikistan. She is good and glorious. She must pay for her first course tuition but she does not have money. Her parents can’t support her as they do not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 900 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: Sajda's Group

texts.en:
Sajda is a 39-year-old hardworking mother of four children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and children. She is a very skilled woman and she is very expert in stitching up dresses. She has been doing this tailoring work for 15 years. All the people in her area are very well satisfied and happy with her work. She provides her services at a very reasonable price and that's why her work is increasing day by day.

Sajda,as a member of a three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by purchasing one more sewing machine. She would be able to stitch dresses more appropriately and efficiently in less time with a new sewing machine. This would increase her net income and savings. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her children.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing one more sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Karibu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sofia  est conseillère du collectif  d’affaire  « Karibu», entrepreneur dynamique expérimentée, âgée de 45 ans et mère de 9 enfants  qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un pécheur (armateur). La cliente est vendeuse d’huile et de la farine de manioc. Elle installe ses produits au marché, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de  son mari,  il y a environ 10 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 bidons d’huile et 1 sac de farine manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une belle maison. L’insuffisance du capital constitue un défi pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Sofia, the customer, is an advisor to the "Karibu" business group. A dynamic and experienced entrepreneur, she is 45 years old and the mother of 9 children who all attend school. Her spouse is a fisherman (and shipowner).

Sofia sells oil and cassava flour. She offers her products to customers at the market and, occasionally, at home. She started her business about 10 years ago with her own funds, received from her husband. This new loan will be used to buy 2 cans of oil and a bag of cassava flour. She would like to increase her business, to feed her children and ensure they get an education, and to build a nice house. The lack of sufficient capital is the main challenge to the growth of her business. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs in the form of microloans.

loans.use: to buy 2 cans of oil and 1 bag of cassava flour.

loans.name: Ineza Ii Group

texts.fr:
Daniel fait partie du groupe  InezaII et   habite à Bujumbura. Il a 42 ans et est marié à Suzanne. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de  1 à 13  ans, dont 2 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge son frère.

Il est menuisier et fait le commerce de produits en bois (tables, chaise, lit,…) depuis 4 ans. 

Il est à son  quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de planches pour la fabrication de tables,  de chaises,… à vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années , il voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Daniel is a member of the Ineza II group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 42 years old and married to Suzanne. The couple have 4 children aged between 1 and 13 years old, 2 of whom attend school. He is also taking care of his brother.

Daniel is a carpenter and has been selling products made out of wood (tables, chairs, beds, etc.) for 4 years. This is his 4th loan from Turame. His Kiva-sponsored loan will increase his capital and allow him to buy a lot of wooden boards with which to make items like tables and chairs, which he will then resell so that he can earn more money. In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land and see his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy a lot of boards with which to make tables, chairs, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Cinyabugu est conseillère du collectif  d’affaire  « Asifiwe», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 36 ans et mère de 7 enfants  qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’administration publique. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers. Elle installe ses articles au marché, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF Hekima,  il y a environ 3 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 15 paires de souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. L’insuffisance du capital constitue un défi pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Cinyabugu, the customer, is an advisor to the "Asifiwe" business group. A young and experienced entrepreneur, she is 36 years old and the mother of 7 children who all attend school. Her spouse is a civil servant.

Cinyabugu sells shoes. She offers her products to customers at the market and, occasionally, at home. She started her business about 3 years ago with a loan she received from the MFI Hekima. This new loan will be used to buy 15 pairs of shoes. She would like to increase her business and to feed her children and ensure they get an education. Her lack of sufficient capital is a challenge to the development of her business. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs in the form of microloans.

Note: one of the customers in the photo is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Hermann Jeannot

texts.fr: Hermann est un jeune homme dede 32 ans.il a  opté faire dans la vente des beignets dans un marché de la place.au regard de mla petitesse de son capital,ilse trouve confronté à un problème de rupture de stock et ses clients szeb trouvesnt insatisfaits. raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter de la faine en grande quantité afin d'(accroitre son offre. cei lui permettra de réaliser les bénéfices.lesquels lui permettront enretour de réaliser ses projets à savoir s'acheter à long terme des pousses qui puissent lui permettre dedistribuer facilement ses beignets dans toute a ville.de même,il aimerait créer une bonne activité pour fonder une famille.
texts.en: Hermann is a young man who is 32 years old. He made the choice to sell fritters in a local market, but because he has very little capital he is confronted with a shortage of stock and cannot satisfy customer demand. For this reason he is requesting a loan so that he can buy a large quantity of flour and increase supply. This will enable him to make money and thereby achieve his objectives which are in the long term to buy rickshaws which will enable to distribute his fritters all over town. He would like to develop a good business to be able to start a family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of flour.

loans.name: Messina
