Wilson was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Low interest rates."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "They buy cows for farmers."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Wilson replied "Milk production will increase."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Wilson owns a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in his household a mosquito net, electricity, a sewing machine, and a TV but does not have solar power, running water, or a DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Panian

texts.en:
Panian has a motorcycle transport business in Kitengela town. He is 45 years of age and married with four children. His wife runs a grocery shop. He has been in this business for 13 years and currently makes a monthly income of 13,000 Kenyan Shillings.

This is his third loan term from KADET LTD and he plans to buy another motorcycle for transport business. He will also use part of the amount to service the one he is currently using. He will use the anticipated income to support his wife's grocery business.

He hopes to have a successful transport business and thereby be able to provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian plants cash crops such as maize and vegetables to sell. She also has a retail shop in Nairobi town. She is 28 years old and married with 1 child. Her husband, who also works, provides additional income to support the family.

This is her second loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. She also plans to buy more goods to sell in her retail shop. These include rice, sugar and flour. She will use the generated income to provide for the basic need of her family.

Lilian hopes to grow her retail shop business and make more income which will enable her to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting and purchase additional goods to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a carpenter in Oloitoktok town, where he makes sofa sets, beds, wall units, wooden tables and also chairs. He is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. This will be his second loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy more timber for making beds and tables. He also plans to buy other materials, such as paint and nails for use in his carpentry business. He will use the generated profits to buy more carpentry machines for use in his workshop. Francis hopes to expand his business and makes more varieties of carpentry items, generate more income and to be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more timber and other materials such as paint and nails for use in carpentry.

loans.name: Njara Blessed Group

texts.en: Mary is a hardworking lady with 5 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is poultry but she also has other income sources such as rental houses, banana plantations and zero grazing. She faces the challenges of price fluctuationa and high cost of feeds; however her dream is to increase her production and supply to a vast market including the city. Mary intends to use this loan to buy chicks for rearing. She is a member of the above mentioned group,where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 45 year old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a clothing shop where he sells a variety of shawls. This is the only source of income for the family.

Presently she needs additional capital for the growth of the business. For that Jameela is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of shawls to sell, so he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

With the profit he will put aside some savings to pay the electricity and gas bills. Jameela hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shawls to sell

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has no children and has been doing dairy work for 5 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

He stated what he finds most enjoyable about farming is getting profits. His biggest challenge is the lack of finances. Animals on the farm have been given the names of Keroi and Lelkina.

Stanley was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Because of the dairy insurance."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "They assist smallholder farmers."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how will this loan benefit his family, Stanley replied, "It will increase the family income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Stanley owns the following: cow and poultry but he does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and solar power but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo is a 42-years-old married man and a father of three children, aged 16, 12 and 8 respectively. Arnulfo lives with his family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. Arnulfo has been in this business for more than three years now. He sells various kinds of goods and items. Arnulfo is asking for a loan to buy soda and beverages, rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings. With this, he will be able to improve the variety of his stocks so that he can attract more buyers, thus augmenting his sales and income. In the future, Arnulfo hopes to expand his business and make it a stable source of his income.

loans.use: to buy soda and beverages, rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 43-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband. Her husband owns a snooker club, in which he has placed 3 to 4 snooker tables, to offer for his customers to play. One of those tables has been depreciating for a long time and now it is fully damaged. Its cloth has been torn and the balls have lost their colors. This loss affects his daily income. He wants to buy a new snooker table but does not have the capacity to purchase it. Abida has requested a loan so that her husband could buy a new snooker table and could run his club smoothly. Abida is very happy after taking this loan and very thankful to Kiva and its field partner.

loans.use: to buy a snooker table for snooker club.

loans.name: Kibii

texts.en: Kibii lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has 1 child and has been doing this work for the past 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops. He has stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is 'Getting profits.', while his biggest challenge is the 'Transpotation of farm inputs.' The animals on his farm have been given the names of 'Murgut'  and 'Chenwach.' Kibii was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'They give a 2 months grace period.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: Juhudi Kilimo assists smallholder farmers.' Kibii's highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Kibii replied 'It will assist in paying school fees.' As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kibii owns the following: 'cow and poultry' but does not own 'a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power and TV' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine or DVD'.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 63 años,  tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad,   el se dedica a la agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de La Primavera,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Carlos va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para siembra de Maíz  y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Carlos enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindad, una vez que cosecha sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de la comunidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en: Carlos is 63,  and has two grown-up children. He works  in agriculture, growing a variety of vegetables including potatoes, manioc and maize on his plot of land located in the town of La Primavera. This is Carlos' first loan with the organisation, and he is going to use it to buy seeds to grow maize,  after first preparing the ground. His reason for requesting the loan is to obtain the resources he needs to grow his crops and make a living. Carlos faces challenges in his business such as bad weather, which often ruins his crops. He will use the profits from his venture to improve his and his family's quality of life, since he is responsible for household expenses. He is a responsible and hard-working individual who is grateful to the organisation for the support it provides. After he harvests his crops, he sells them in the community market directly from the producer to the consumer.

loans.use: to buy seeds to sow maize.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, 49, is married with two children between the ages of two and four. She has been a farmer for the past 23 years. 

She has applied for her third loan from KADET Ltd. to buy farm inputs, like seeds, chemicals and fertilizers to use on her farm. She hopes to continue farming and become a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, chemicals and fertilizers

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad, 37, is married and lives with spouse in the Bolnisi district of Georgia. A car mechanic, Zviad owns an auto repair shop and serves local drivers. His wife works as a teacher at the local school and gets a small monthly salary.  

Because their existing income is hardly enough for a young couple, Zviad has decided to further develop his business. He has requested a loan to purchase engine oil to sell at his repair shop. He will offer his clients oil-changing services as well.
 
Zviad is very enthusiastic and hard working with a great desire to get ahead. This loan will be a great support for the family. 

He is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase engine oil for selling

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah, 36, has two children. She has been poultry farming in Kangundo town for the past four years. She supplies chickens and eggs to hotels and restaurants. Besides poultry farming, she runs a beauty shop.

This is Monicah’s fourth loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to buy more chicks for rearing. She will also buy more chicken feed and improve the breeding place for the poultry by building a better poultry shed. She also plans to buy beauty products to sell in her beauty shop. 

Monicah will use the income she generates to provide for the needs of her family. She  hopes to grow her businesses by supplying her chicken to all the big hotels in the region as well as expanding her beauty shop.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feed and to build a better poultry shed.

loans.name: Gerbie

texts.en:
This is Gerbie. He previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Gerbie dreams that his business will continue to grow and hopes to have a peaceful and happy life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business

loans.name: Diega

texts.en:
Diega is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods to the people in her place. 

Diega is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, sodas and other beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her store and attract more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Diega has hopes of making her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, sodas and other beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 51 años de edad. Cuenta con 26 años de experiencia en el cuido de ganado de engorde en repasto,esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales también ayudan en el cuido de los animales, una hija estudia octavo grado. Ana aprendió el trabajo junto a su esposo ya que no tienen ningún nivel de estudios y las oportunidades de empleo son casi nulas;  ella lleva sus animales a pastar durante todo el día, y en época lluviosa siembra maicillo para guardar zacate para en la época seca tener comida para su ganado, ademas destaza cerdos una vez por semana y comercializa la carne de casa en casa por toda la comunidad hasta venderla toda 

Para comprar sus animales tiene que abordar un camión de los que van al tiangue, este viaja tarda durante casi una hora, al llegar tiene que escoger los animales que le gustan y negociarlos, esto puede tardar casi todo el día, luego los carga en el camión y viaja de regreso a casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4  novillos de engorde en repasto de unos $350 cada uno. De esta manera incrementara su hato, lo que ayudara a que las ventas puedan ser mas continuas. Teniendo mayor número de animales, las ventas serán mas continuas, por lo que sus ingresos también lo serán, y esto vendrá a mejorar su calidad de vida y así también su hija podrá asegurar sus estudios.

 Planea ahorrar para darle estudio a su hija y que esta pueda graduarse como una profesional, para que tenga una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 51 years old.  She has 26 years experience looking after and grazing cattle to fatten them up.  Ana is married and has three children, who also help to look after the animals.  One of her daughters is in eighth grade.  Ana learned her trade alongside her husband as they have no education and their chances of employment were almost nil.  Ana takes her animals to graze all day and, in the rainy season, grows corn so that she has fodder to feed the cattle in the dry season.  In addition Ana cuts up pigs once a week to sell from door to door in the community - she keeps going until there is no meat left.

In order to buy her animals, Ana has to board a lorry to get to the market.  The journey lasts almost an hour and, once there, she has to choose the animals she likes and negotiate the price.  This can take all day.  At the end of the day, she loads the animals into the lorry and makes the journey back home.

Ana is applying to "Fundación Campo" for a loan to buy four heifers to graze and fatten up - each heifer costs $350.  With more heifers, Ana will increase her small herd, helping her sales to be more constant.  With a larger number of animals and continuous sales, Ana will have a more constant income and this will improve her quality of life and she will be able to pay for her daughter's education.

Ana plans to save money so her daughter can study and become a professional - she can then have a better life.

loans.use: to buy four heifers to graze and fatten up - each heifer costs $350.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 60 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edna has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vandy

texts.en:
Vandy is 30 years old. She has been married since 2005 and has two young daughters. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband is a security guard.

Vandy has been weaving for five years. She hopes to expand her property; hence she is applying for a loan to buy her neighboring land.

loans.use: To buy her neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.name: Playeritas De Chua Caicoto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PLAYERITAS DE CHUA CAICOTO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celestina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de CD’s, carpintería, venta de queso, venta de ganado, venta de lanas, tejido de camas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celestina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de camas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás aprendiendo la técnica de una señora a quien le ayudaba y posteriormente decide implementar su propio espacio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en los centro turísticos de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que el desembolso sea en el mismo lugar.
texts.en:
The "Playeritas de Chua Caicoto" communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Copacabana office.  This group is made up of nine members and is directed by a board which has Celestina as its president.  The members have various types of business, including: selling milk, selling CDs, a carpentry business, selling cheese, selling cattle, selling wool, and making blankets.

This loan will benefit micro-enterprises in Celestina's group.  Celestina tells us that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, following an invitation from one of the organisation's representatives who went to visit her in her home.  Celestina currently has a business making knitting products and selling beds.  She says that she learned this trade some years ago from a woman who helped her.  She later decided to set up her own business.

Celestina will use this loan to increase her capital, by buying more wool from the nearby markets.  She will then make her products and sell them in the tourist centres of La Paz.  This work allows Celestina to earn her own income to maintain her household as best as possible.  Ana is married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Celestina tells us that she likes that the payments are all made on the same site.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is forty years, married to Lucy, and a father of three children. He runs a car hire business in Kangemi, Kenya and has been in this business for thirteen years. He gets a monthly income of KES 55,000.

This will be John's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy tires and spare parts for the cars. 

In future John hopes to open different car hire branches.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tires

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has three children and has been doing this work for seven years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Feeding the cows.' His biggest challenge is 'Cutting the nappier grass using the manual method.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Lelgut, Tilito, and Murgut.'

Peter was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Low interest rates.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They provide financial assistance to smallholder farmers.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit his family', Peter replied 'Milk production will increase.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peter owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, TV' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell like eggs, noodles, spices, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Erminda has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal and rice and farming rice.

Erminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell like eggs, noodles, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Beatríz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 37 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Posee 2 años de experiencia en su tortilleria, ella trabajo como empleada en una tortilleria durante 5 años, ahí le pagaban $3.00 al día, al ver lo que ganaba no le alcanzaba para el sostenimiento de su familia decidió iniciar su propio negocio. Tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian sexto grado y su compañero de vida trabaja como jornal en unos cañales ganando $4.00 por día, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y la jornada de trabajo inicia a las 7:00 de la mañana poniendo a cocer el maíz, luego lo lleva al molino y a las 9:00 de la mañana empieza a hacer las tortillas terminando a la 1:00 de la tarde, luego inicia otro turno a las 3:00 de la tarde y termina a las 6:30 de la tarde, el trabajo lo hace ella sola y las ganancias del negocio las va invirtiendo en compra de algunos enseres para el hogar y el estudio de sus hijos

 Para producir sus tortillas compra el maíz en una tienda cercana a su casa y la leña se la compra a personas que andan vendiendo en pick up, por la comunidad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 5 sacos de maíz a $40.00 cada uno. Así,  comprara el maíz de una sola vez y  pedirá que le den precio mas bajo y evitara estar perdiendo tiempo en comprar a cada ratito.

Al tener el maíz almacenado en su casa ella estará mas segura de no fallarle a sus clientes con sus tortillas, ya que cuando el maíz escasea en las tiendas genera atrasos en su negocio..

Ella planea ahorrar para que sus hijos puedan estudiar y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Carmen is 37 years old,  has a partner and two children. She has two years of experience running her tortilla business, as she worked as an employee in one for 5 years. They paid her $3.00 a day, but seeing that what she earned was not enough to support her family, she decided to set up her own business. Her two children study in the sixth grade and her partner works as a labourer in sugar cane plantations earning $4.00 a day.  

Her business is in her home and she starts work at 7:00 in the morning, cooking corn. She then takes it to be ground up and and 9:00 she starts making the tortillas, finishing at 13:00 in the afternoon. She then begins the whole process again at 15:00 and finishes at 18:30. She works alone and invests her earnings in buying household goods and her children's education. She buys the corn to make her tortillas from a nearby shop, and she buys firewood from people who go around the town selling it from their pick-up. 

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 5 bags of corn for $40.00 each. Buying this a large amount at once means she can get it for a lower price, and avoid wasting time having to buy more corn every time. Being able to store the corn in her home also means that she can always be sure of having enough for her customers, since when there is a shortage of corn in the shops this creates delays in her business.

Her plan is to save up so that her children can study to become professionals.

loans.use:
to buy 5 bags of corn, worth $40.00 each.
.

loans.name: Barrio Municipal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BARRIO MUNICIPAL”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Micaela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de transporte, tejido de mantas, venta de productos varios, tejido de mantas y chambritas, constructor, salón de peluquería, venta de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Micaela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una prima que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de salón de peluquería; este negocio lo emprendió recientemente ya que concluyó sus estudios técnicos en peluquería y el préstamo que sacara es para el aumento de capital.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de secadoras y espejos) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantenerse independiente ya que ella aún es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las reuniones y hacer nuevas clientas
texts.en:
The “BARRIO MUNICIPAL” communal bank will begin its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Collpani center. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors, of which Micaela is the president. The communal bank members' businesses are varied. Among them are: transportation service, knitting blankets, selling various products, knitting blankets and jackets, construction,  a hair salon, and selling shoes. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, one of whom is Micaela. She indicates that this is the first time that she is a part of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a cousin who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has a hair salon. She started this business recently, since she finished her training in hairstyling techniques and the loan she will take out now is to increase her capital. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital, buying dryers and mirrors. She will acquire them from the markets in the city of El Alto and later install them in her workspace. This work will allow her to generate resources to support herself independently, since she is still single. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the meetings and making new clients.

loans.use: to buy a dryer and mirrors.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens and pigs and selling pre-paid mobile load. Leah is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to  buy additional groceries to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc. for her general store business.

Leah successfully paid back her two previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and improve her pig and poultry business.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Sam Ang

texts.en:
Sam Ang (pictured here) lives in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She has four children: two sons and two daughters. 

Sam Ang’s family has three lines of business: raising fish, rice farming, and construction contracting.

Sam Ang previously asked for a Kiva loan and she has successfully paid it off. She is now asking for another loan in order to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia tiene 27 años, tiene tres hijos, que  se dedica a la  venta de variedad de verduras en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Pampahasi,   la Sra. Sonia va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de verduras, tomate por mayor,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere abastecerse de este producto, la Sra. Sonia enfrenta retos en su negocio que el tener que levantarse temprano para comprar sus verduras y la competencia y  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar cosas para su vivienda, se siente feliz ya agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Sonia is 27, has three children, and makes a living selling a variety of vegetables from her stall located in the area of Pampahasi. Sonia is going to use the loan to buy vegetables, such as wholesale tomatoes. Her reason for requesting the loan is that she want to stock up on produce.Sonia faces business challenges such as having to get up early to buy her vegetables, and competition. She is going to use her earnings to buy items for her home. She feels happy and grateful to the organisation for the support it provides because this is the only activity through which she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries for her general store business.

Marilou has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving  enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries

loans.name: Juan Lorenzo

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre viudo de 49  años de edad, vive junto a sus 6 hijos (3 hombres y 3 mujeres) en el Caserío El Oratorio, Cantón Chuaxic, Sololá, Sololá.
El es un hombre trabajador que quiere lo mejor para su familia trabajando siempre unidos, el se dedica al cultivo de zanahoria en el terreno que tiene. Eligio esta labor porque sus tres hijos lo apoyan con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos y ganancias para la economía familiar. 
Las cosechas que ha tenido han sido buenas y es por ello que desea cultivar nuevamente en su terreno, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de  Q 5,000.00 para comprar semillas de zanahoria y  abono orgánico y de esta manera cultivar para tener una  buena cosecha. 
Su sueño es generar más ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos para que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a widower of 49 years old.  Juan lives with his six children (three sons and three daughters) in the El Oratorio hamlet in the Chuaxic canton in Sololá, Sololá.  Juan is hard-working and wants the best for his united family.  Juan makes a living growing carrots on his land.  He chose this work because his three sons support him in order to increase his profits and income for the family finances.

Juan has had good harvests and so wants to grow more on his land.  For this, Juan is applying for a loan of 5,000 Qetzal to buy carrot seeds and organic manure and to grow crops for a good harvest.

Juan's dream is to earn more profits and so improve his children's quality of life. so that they have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and organic manure for crops.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina,  tiene 53 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijas dependientes, se dedica principalmente a la producción agrícola y en sus tiempos libres trabaja en diferentes parcelas de su comunidad con el objetivo de dar una buena alimentación y educación a sus hijas, ya son varios años que la señora cristina mantiene sola a sus hijas ya que su pareja y padre de sus hijas  por cosas de la vida les abandono, este año por la escases de lluvia su producción no está rindiendo al cien por ciento aparte que se está infectando de enfermedades principalmente la cebolla, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el cual quiere comprar abono orgánico, agroquímicos y abono químico, y así tener una buena cosecha esta gestión que mejore sus ingresos económicos y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia y retomar el camino de la prosperidad.
texts.en: Cristina is 53 years old and single, with two dependent children. She works principally in agricultural production, and in her free time she works on various plots of land in her community, with the aim of giving good nutrition and education to her children. For a number of years now, Cristina has supported her daughters by herself, because her partner and the father of her daughters abandoned them, as these things happen in life. This year, because of the scarcity of rainfall, her crops are not producing 100%, and in addition they are being infected by diseases, especially the onions. For this reason, she is requesting a loan with which she would like to buy organic fertilizer, agricultural chemicals and chemical fertilizer, in order to have a good harvest. This initiative will increase her income and thus improve the quality of life for all of her family members, so that they can return to the path that leads to prosperity.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, agricultural chemicals and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo Olo  y de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se dedica a las labores agrícolas, antes ayudaba a sus padres y hoy trabaja en las tierras junto a su esposo. Todas las mañanas siembra papa, alverja y maíz en sus chacras propias, y le gusta despertarse muy temprano para vigilar sus campos, pues sabe que de su esfuerzo constante depende que obtenga una cosecha productiva la cual venderá a buenos precios a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Luego de la cosecha comercializa  todos sus productos naturales, pues sus compradores conocen de la calidad de su producción. Pero siempre trabaja pensando en sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues quiere que estudien una carrera y sean profesionales, además dice que lo más trabajoso es trasladar toda su producción para comercializarla, ya que los sacos son bastante pesados. Este es su cuarto con crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Rosa, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband Olo and their 2 children. Since she was very young, she has worked in farming. Before, she would help her parents and now she works the land with her husband. Every morning she plants potatoes, peas and corn in her own fields. She likes to get up very early to watch over her fields, because she knows that getting a good yield from her crops depends on her constant effort. She will sell her crops at a good price to wholesalers in the city. After harvest, she sells all of her natural products, and her buyers know the quality of her yield. She always works while thinking of getting her children ahead. She wants them to go to college and learn a profession. She also says that the hardest part of her job is transporting the product to sell it, since the sacks are very heavy. This is her fourth loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support she is getting to get ahead. She is also committed to making her payments on time. 

Rosa will invest the S/.2,500 soles in buying organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Evaline works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Evaline is borrowing 19000 PHP through NWTF to purchase snack foods, beauty products, sugar, soap, shampoo, and other items to sell. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and rice farming business.

Evaline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, beauty products, sugar, soap, shampoo, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years. Virginia earns additional income from her general store and from raising pigs.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar, 22 years old, is a Yemeni youth client. He lives in Taiz, Yemen, and he is the breadwinner of his family. He has not gotten married yet because he doesn't have enough money to improve his living standards. He is a hardworking man getting a low income.

He has a small house and he intends to renovate it, so he requested a youth loan in the amount of 250,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies to renovate his house. He looks forward to improving his living standards in order to get married.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate his house

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Conchita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Conchita is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her vegetables and spices business.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Kyamazima Twimuke Group

texts.en:
John used the previous loan to buy charcoal to sell. He is a 63-year-old married man with nine children. He lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He operates a charcoal store, a business he has carried out for the last 35 years. His major challenge has been high operational costs while his dream is to diversify and deal in other energy sources such as solar systems.

John is requesting this loan to buy charcoal to sell. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his sister's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 47-year-old married woman living with her spouse and 8 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her 4 sons are doing different jobs in different firms.

Her husband makes saws at home and sells into the market. A saw is a hand tool with a toothed blade used to cut hard materials such as wood or bone. It is among the oldest known tools. Innovations made over thousands of years ago are still present in modern day. He has been making saws for many years and feeding his family.

As with the increase in the needs of his family, her husband wants to grow his business also. Therefore, Zarina asked for a loan of 35,000 PKR from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could grow his business.  She hopes that this loan will prove a productive and beneficial one for the business and for her family also.

Zarina is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and pieces of wood for making saws

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a very fertile ground for agricultural production. He is married and has three children, all of whom are of school-going age.  He has been a mixed farmer for 15 years. His main source of income is cash crops and horticultural crops.

He has an interest in poultry farming but he needs capital and thus has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo for starting poultry farming. He says this loan will help him increase his income base and thus be able to educate his children and also improve their standard of living. The challenges he faces are insufficient funds and poor markets.

In five years he intends to have over 5,000 poultry, both layers and broilers.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es: Nimia, tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al  municipio de San Pedro Sula. Cortes.  Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de pan y tamales. Hace 12 años se dedica a su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como ser carnes, embutidos, churros, granos básicos, refrescos etc. Ella ha mantenido estable su negocio mediante la inversión de varios préstamos con ODEF. El préstamo actual que ha solicitado es el numero doce y es por 8,000 Lempiras,  con  el cual va  comprar productos alimenticios como granos básicos, azúcar, pan, refrescos, churros, productos de limpieza y abarrotes y  poder surtir  la pulpería. Su plan es lograr el objetivo de llegar hacer abarrotería grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Nimia is 47 years old, married, has two children, and lives in a town located in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. In the past, she made a living selling bread and tamales, a traditional stuffed-corn dish. 12 years ago, she set up her own grocery store selling foodstuffs such as meat, sausages, churros, basic grains, fizzy drinks, and other items. 

She has kept her business on an even keel through the investment of various loans with ODEF. The loan of 8,000 Lempiras she is requesting at the moment will be her eleventh. She will use it to buy goods such as basic grains, sugar, bread, fizzy drinks, churros, cleaning products, and groceries to stock her shop. Her plan is to achieve her goal of making her business a big  grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic household foodstuffs such as basic grains, sugar, flour, bread, fizzy drinks, churros, and other provisions.

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en: Bonny, 44, is a married man with 8 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a mechanic but also practices farming and owns a cinema hall to earn a living. He faces  the hardships of customers not paying on time and limited capital, while his dreams are to diversify into rental houses and also own a modern garage. Bonny intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Alma Lucia

texts.es: Alma Lucia 54 años de edad casada  con cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país. Es propietaria de dos negocios como es la venta de comida y una carpintería ubicada en su casa de habitación y el de comida en uno de los mercados de esta localidad, no es primer crédito con león 2000, Alma se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, que ha logrado salir adelante, con esfuerzos propios, el objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como es la madera, tornillos, entre otros para la producción de muebles como: camas comerciales, especiales, roperos, sillas cómodas, entre otros mas, sus ventas son al Contado y al crédito los cuales recupera semanal, quincenal y mensualmente, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales. Alma agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Alma Lucia is 54 years old and married, with five children who are all grown-ups. She is from the town of Chinandega, in the west of the country. She owns two businesses, one selling food in a local market and the other a carpentry workshop located in her home. This isn't her first loan with León 2000. 

Alma is an enterprising woman, who has managed to make a success of things through her own hard work. The purpose of this loan is to buy raw materials such as wood and screws to make furniture including beds, wardrobes, and comfortable chairs. Her customers can pay her in cash or credit, which she collects on a weekly, fortnightly and monthly basis. She has regular and prospective clients. Alma is very grateful for the support given to people with low incomes by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood, screws, reeds, sanders, brushes and other items.

loans.name: Ketty María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Ketty, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 10 y 5 años de edad, el  mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo técnico en aparatos eléctricos.

Doña Ketty  es una muy buena esposa y madre que le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia, ella  se dedica a la fabricación de botones hechos en tagua, para esto tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, productos que entrega a  comerciantes mayoristas que llegan hasta este lugar a comprar para luego llevarlas a Manta para que estos sean enviados  al extranjero para que sean terminados. Lleva más de 7 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le da lo necesario para los estudios de sus hijos que es lo más importante para ella.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua para la fabricación de los botones. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del mismo y le gusta la ayuda que le dan.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Virgen Del Rosario" (Virgen of the Rosary) meets every fifteen days in Colorado in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its artisanry, which is recognized nationally and internationally. Here, most of the inhabitants work at making buttons out of ivory nut, other crafts, and business in general.

Ketty, 33 years old, lives here. She is married and with her husband, she has three children, aged 15, 10 and 5. The oldest studies in high school and the two younger children are also in school. Her husband works at repairing electronic appliances.

Ketty is an excellent wife and mother who enjoys working to put her family first. Her primary activity is making buttons made from the ivory nut. She has a lathe for this purpose, a machine that will cut the ivory nut, and she uses it to make raw buttons. She then delivers these to wholesalers that come to her hometown to purchase them, then later take them to Manta where they will be sent abroad for finishing. She has seven years of experience in this line of work, and it provides her the means to send her children to school, which is the most important thing for her.

Ketty will use this loan to purchase ivory nut so she can make her buttons. She has been part of the communal bank from the start - in fact, she is the secretary - and she appreciates the help it gives. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: purchase ivory nut.

loans.name: Rosa Del Pilar

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí vive la señora Rosa, tiene 35 años  de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 17, 15 y  13 años de edad, el menor estudia en colegio. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.

Doña Rosa es una muy buena madre que para que a sus hijos no les falte nada se dedica a la fabricación de botones hechos en tagua, para lo cual  tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, productos que entrega a  comerciantes que llegan hasta este lugar a comprar para luego llevarlas a Manta para que estos sean enviados  al extranjero. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos y lleva en este negocio por casi dos años, actividad con la cual sale adelante.

Con este crédito ella va a comprar tagua que es la  materia prima para la fabricación de los botones. Lleva 6 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades de pago.
 
Su sueño es tener una fábrica grande con mayor tecnología.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Virgen Del Rosario" (Virgin of the Rosary) meets every fifteen days in Colorado in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its artisanry, which is recognized nationally and internationally. Here, most of the inhabitants work at making buttons out of ivory nut, other crafts, and business in general.

Rosa, 35 years old, lives here. She is a single mother of three children aged 17, 15, and 13. The youngest studies in high school. She lives in her parents' home.

Rosa is an excellent mother who works hard to be sure that her children want for nothing. Her primary activity is making buttons made from the ivory nut. She has a drill for this purpose, a machine that will cut the ivory nut, and she uses it to make raw buttons. She then delivers these to wholesalers that come to her hometown to purchase them, then later take them to Manta where they will be sent abroad for finishing. She works every day with her childrens' help, and has two years of experience in this line of work, work which helps get her family ahead.

With this loan, she will purchase ivory nut, which is the raw material needed for her buttons. She's been in the communal bank for six terms and she enjoys how easy it is to make payments. Her dream is to run a large factory with better technology.

loans.use: purchase ivory nut.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 37 years old and married with five children, three of whom in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been farming rice for 16 years, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 30 years old and married with one child.

Angeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, bread, etc..

Angeline has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Angeline aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 10 y 6 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido trabaja en una fábrica en Manta. 

Doña Jessica para ayudarle a su esposo a solventar con los gastos del hogar ya que con lo que él gana no alcanza para cubrir los gastos hace 6 años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa, allí todos los días prepara en las mañanas el deliciosos ceviches de pescado y camarón y por las noches vende fritada, todos esto acompañado de jugos, sodas u otras bebidas a preferencia de sus clientes, trabaja todos los días sola y en ciertos días con la ayuda de su marido cuando él está desocupado.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años y  le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Virgen Del Rosario" (Virgin of the Rosary) meets every fifteen days in Colorado in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its artisanry, which is recognized nationally and internationally. Here, most of the inhabitants work at making buttons out of ivory nut, other crafts, and business in general.

Jessica, 28 years old, lives here. She is married, and she and her husband have three children, aged 11, 10 and 6. The oldest studies in high school and the two younger children are also in school. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

Since her husband's wages did not cover the household expenses, Jessica began a business six years ago to help meet the family's needs. She opened a small diner in their house, and every morning she makes delicious fish and shrimp ceviches and at night she sells fritada, a traditional dish of fried pork, along with juices, sodas, and other drinks that her clients prefer. She works everyday, mostly alone, but sometimes with her husband's help when he isn't working. 

This loan will be used to buy fish and other supplies for making her dishes. She has been in the communal bank for two years and she appreciates the help that the loans have given her. Her goals are to continue getting ahead in her business and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: purchase fish.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix, tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de el Negrito, Yoro. El tiene 10 años de ser productor de los granos básicos principalmente de maíz. Estuvo un tiempo en el extranjero pero decidió mejor dedicarse a la agricultura. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado de 8,000 lempiras, va poder comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para su limpieza y aplicación del fertilizante en el cultivo de maíz. Esta inversión le ayudara a sacar mejor cosecha. Tiene como plan  aumentar los ingresos para mantener mejor a su familia y darles estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Félix is 50 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a village near El Negrito, Yoro. He's produced basic grains, mostly corn, for ten years. He spent some time abroad, but decided that being a farmer was better. He sells his crops in the local regional market. With this loan for 8,000 lempiras, he will be able to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor to clean it and apply it on his corn fields. This investment will help him to achieve a better harvest. His plan is to increase his income so that he can better sustain his family and ensure his children get to go to school.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and pay for its application

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a roof in front of his home

loans.name: Sector Los Chumil-Maíz Group

texts.es:
Martín es el representante del Grupo Sector Los Chumil-Maíz (de camisa azul el primero que se encuentra del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es un  hombre casado de 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4  hijos: 1 hombre y  3  mujeres en el Sector Los Chumil, Caserío Xolbé, Cantón El Tablón Sololá.
El  es un hombre que se dedica a la agricultura y que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia. Comenta que él se dedica a la siembra de maíz a unos metros de su vivienda desde hace 20 años. 
Eligió este tipo de actividad porque sus padres le enseñaron y es por ello que sigue con la tradición que le heredaron. A través de de lo que realiza lo puede comercializar y alimentar a su familia. Esta actividad le genera ingresos y ganancias aceptables para contribuir a la economía de su familia.
Los demás integrantes del grupo utilizaran la otra parte del crédito para la siembra  de maíz, con el fin de incrementar sus ganancias para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abono orgánico para el cultivo de maíz.
Su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos en los estudios para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida en un futuro.
texts.en:
Martín is the representative of the Sector Los Chumil-Maíz group. He is wearing a blue shirt and standing on the far left in the photograph. He is 37, married, and lives with his four children, a boy and three girls in the district of Los Chumil, Caserío Xolbé, Canton El Tablón, Sololá.

He works in agriculture, and fights to move forwards with his family.  He says that he has made a living growing corn near his home for 20 years. He chose this type of activity because his parents taught it to him, and he is following on the  tradition he inherited from them. Through his work, he is able to sell his crops and feed his family. His activity generates acceptable revenues and earnings to contribute to the family income.

The other group members will use the rest of the loan to grow corn, with the aim of boosting their earnings and offering their families a better quality of life. The loan will be used to buy organic compost for corn crops. 

Martín's dream is to support his children in thier studies so that they have a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic compost to grow corn.

loans.name: Selvin Geovany

texts.es: Selvin, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Arizona atlántica. Anteriormente se dedicaba a comercializar ganado. Hace 3 años que decidió por establecer su propio negocio que es una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, refrescos, azúcar, pan, dulces, churros, refrescos y golosinas etc. Ha solicitado un segundo ciclo de préstamo a ODEF por 13,000 lempiras para surtir e incrementar el inventario de granos básicos, azúcar, harina, refrescos, churros, dulces etc.y lograr mejores ganancias. El tiene como meta terminar de construir su casa y ver que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en: Selvin is 32 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with his wife and their 4 children.  He lives in a village that is part of the municipality of Arizona, Atlantida.  He previously worked selling livestock.  Three years ago he decided to start his own business, which is a  grocery store where he sells food products such as basic grains, soft drinks, sugar, bread, sweets, churros, candy, etc.  He is requesting a second loan from ODEF of 13,000 lempiras to supply and increase his inventory of basic grains, sugar, flour, soft drinks, churros, sweets, etc. and improve his earnings.  His goal is to finish building his house and to see his children complete their education.

loans.use: to supply his grocery store with food products such as basic grains, sugar, flour, soft drinks, churros, sweets and candy.

loans.name: Mercedes Eulalia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 47 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. El marido es artesano. 

Doña Mercedes realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo en su trabajo, él tiene una pequeña fábrica en la cual elaboran harina de pescado, él y sus hijos trabajan de lunes a viernes en la elaboración de este producto,  el se desplaza a Manta para comprar la parte del pescado que no utilizan las fabricas de atún, la misma que luego de procesada la entregan a comerciantes que la exportan al extranjero donde este producto es muy utilizado. El lleva más de 15 años en esta actividad con la cual ha sacado adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado para  elaborar la harina. Está  en el Banco Comunal desde hace 6 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario [Virgin of the Rosary Communal Bank] gathers every two weeks in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial history and world renown handicrafts. Most of its inhabitants make a living from the manufacture of vegetable ivory buttons, handicrafts and commerce.

This is the place where Mrs. Mercedes lives. She is 47 years old, married and has three adult children, two of which live with her. His husband is an artisan.

Mercedes is requesting this loan to help her husband in his work. He has a small factory in which fishmeal is made. He and their children work Monday to Friday making this product. He goes first to Manta to buy the fish parts that are not used by tuna factories, which after being processed are then delivered to sellers who export it since this item is used widely abroad. He has been doing this for more than 15 years, and has been able to provide for his family by doing so.

This loan will be used to buy fish to elaborate the fishmeal. She has been in the Banco Comunal for 6 lending cycles, and likes it because of the help that they give her.

Her dream is to move on.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Petita Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Petita, tiene 56 años de edad está casada pero no ha podido tener hijos. El marido trabaja ocasionalmente. 

Doña Petita para salir adelante ya que su marido en ocasiones no trabaja hace 6 años y con el primer crédito que recibió del banco arreglo un local en su casa para poner una pequeña tienda de víveres, vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, sodas, aguas entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo, gracias a esto ellos salen adelante y está muy agradecida con la institución ya que con cada crédito ella mejora su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años y le gusta porque con el crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The community bank Virgen Del Rosario (Virgin of the Rosary) meets every two weeks in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, a place known for it's rich pre-colonial culture and it's crafts that are recognized at a national and international level. Most of the inhabitants of this place work making buttons from tagua (a nut that can be carved like ivory), crafts, and general commerce. 
56 year old Petita lives here and is married but was not able to have kids. Her husband works occasionally. 
As her husband sometimes doesn't have work, and in order to get ahead, six years ago Petita took out her first loan from the community bank and set-up a little grocery store in her house. She sells all sorts of things such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, sodas, water, and other things. She works everyday from 6:00am until 8:00pm and sometimes until later. Her husband helps her in her work. Thanks to this, they are doing well and she is very grateful to the institution as she grows her business with every loan. 
She will use this loan to better stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other staple groceries. She has been a member of the community bank for 6 years and she likes it because the loans enabled her to start her business. 
Her goal is to carry on her business and to grow her store every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other staple groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her stationery store: boxes, notebooks, paper punchers, etc.

loans.name: Maritza Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 20, 18, 12 y 11 años de edad,  los dos menores  estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es artesano. 

Doña Maritza realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo con su negocio, él tiene un taller de cerrajería en la localidad, allí elabora puertas, ventanas y otras estructuras con el hierro, trabaja todos los días y siempre está ocupado ya que no le falta trabajo, mientras que ella se desempeña como ama de casa y además también trabaja en una fábrica de botones del lugar por lo cual recibe un sueldo. Su marido tiene este taller ya por más de 10 años y le va muy bien gracias a Dios.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar hierro, pintura, soldaduras y otros  materiales necesarios para el negocio de su marido. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido. 

Su sueño es tener su propio taller de botones.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Rosario community bank meets every fortnight in Colorado in Montecristi Cantón, renowned for its rich precolonial culture and handicrafts, which are famous nationally and internationally.  The majority of its inhabitants make a living producing tagua buttons, handicrafts, and in business in general. 

Señora Maritza lives here. She is 40 and has a partner with whom she has four children aged 20, 18, 12 and 11. The two youngest study in school and college. Her husband is a craftsman.

Maritza is requesting this loan to help her husband with his business. He has a metal workshop in the neighborhood, where he makes doors, windows and other structures from iron. He works every day and is always busy with plenty of work, while she works as a housewife and in a local button factory, which provides her with an income. Her husband has had his workshop for over 10 years, and thanks to God, it is doing very well.

She is going to use the loan to buy iron, paint, welding and other materials necessary for her husband's business. She has been a member of the Community Bank for four cycles, and she likes it because the group is very united. 

Her dream is to have her own button factory.

loans.use: to buy iron, paint, welding, etc.

loans.name: Aissa

texts.fr: AÏSSA est une femme célibataire 39 ans,mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 07 et 17 ans. tous sont scolarisés. elle fait dans la cofection des habits depuis 03 ans..compte tenu de l'étroitesse de son atelier et de la petitesse de son capital,elle est constamment confrontée à un problème  et d'insatisfaction de sa clientèle. raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter les produits de mercerie afin de les stocker pour  son activité. les bénéfices qui en résulteront  lui permettront d'étendre son activité en en achetant d'autes machines à coudre pouvant lui permettre d'aider les jeunes pour une formation dans le domaine.de même,elle compte sur cette activité pour subvenir à ses besoins vitaux et devenir autonome.
texts.en:
Aissa is a single 39-year-old mother of three children, who are between 7 and 17 years old. All the children have been to school.

Aissa has been making clothes for three years. Given her small workshop and her lack of capital, she is constantly confronted with customer dissatisfaction. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy haberdashery items in order to stock herself for her business.

The earnings will allow her to expand her business by buying additional sewing machines, which will allow her to help train young apprentices.

Additionally, she counts on this business to support her needs so she can become independent.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery items

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Doña Irma con una edad de 36 años es madre de 5 hijos, casada, ama de casa y agricultora ya que ella trabaja en una empresa que se dedica a la compra de esta producto y su trabajo es la clasificación del mismo mientras no está en el campo con su familia. Tiene 4 años de educación primaria y su esposo también trabaja en horarios rotativos como guardia de seguridad siendo sus hijos ayuda con las actividades en el campo en ausencia de sus padres. El terreno que ella tiene es propio gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres y otra parte es comprada.

En la actualidad los insumos que se utilizan para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café son caros y llevan un costo adicional por el acarreo del mismo por lo cual ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara y trasladara los insumos agrícolas para dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café. 

Su meta es mejorar sus cultivos con la compra de los insumos haciendo de ellos un mejor follaje, un mejor grano y protegiendo la planta de bichos entre otros. Esto ayudara a que sus cultivos se fortalezcan y sean atractivos para sus clientes de esta forma ella generara más ingresos para su familia y mejorara sus condiciones de vida re invirtiendo en sus cultivos y trabajando con honestidad.
texts.en:
36 year old Irma is mother to 5 children, is married, and works as a housewife and farmer and she works in a business that buys coffee and her work is to classify it when she is not in the fields with her family. She spent 4 years at elementary school. Her husband also works on a rotating schedule as a security guard so their children help with the farming tasks when their parents can't be there. Some of the land that she owns she inherited from her parents and some of it was bought. 
Currently, the additives that she uses to maintain her coffee crop are expensive and come with an additional transportation expense so she has requested a loan from the Comixmul cooperative to buy and transport agricultural supplies to boost her coffee crops. 
Her goal is to improve her crops by buying additives that will give them better foliage and better berries and protect them from vermin. This will help her because her crops will be strengthened and attractive to her customers and so she will generate greater income for her family and improve their living conditions by investing in her crops and working with honesty.

loans.use: to buy and transport agricultural supplies for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make concrete slabs for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a canvas awning for her business.

loans.name: Fanny Enriqueta

texts.es: Fanny, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos. Reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Barbará. Fanny tiene 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de alimentos y abarrotería donde vende: granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, productos de higiene y limpieza, manteca, azúcar, churros, pan y golosinas. Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar la agricultura junto a su esposo. Esta solicitando el segundo préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de carnes, embutidos, azúcar, harina,manteca, condimentos, refrescos y detergentes. Este préstamo le ayuda a capitalizarse y a surtir su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias. Ella tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio y ser reconocida en la comunidad.
texts.en: 30 year old Fanny lives with her common law husband and 2 children. She lives with her family in the rural community of the Municipio de Nueva Frontera, in the Santa Barbará department. Fanny has 2 years of experience selling foods and groceries such as: staple grains, meats, sodas, hygiene and cleaning products, butter, sugar, churros, bread, and candy. She previously worked as a farmer along with her husband. She is requesting her second loan for $750 while she will use to buy meats, sausages, sugar, flour, butter, condiments, sodas, and detergents. This loan will help her build her capital and supply her store so she can make better profits. Her goal is to make her business grow and to be recognized in the community.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs such as rice, meet, sausages, sugar, butter, sodas, flour, condiments, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Lauriano

texts.en: Lauriano is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. He is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle. Lauriano has been in this business for 20 years. Lauriano earns additional income from farming rice. Lauriano has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams of saving enough so he can pay for his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for maintenance of the motorcycle he uses in his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en: Bashir is 26 years old, a married man with one child who lives in Sana`a, Yemen . He has owned a bakery for 10 years. It is the only source of income for him and his family. He has attracted more clients and retained them. He established his business with a small capital. Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he faces difficulty because of lack of money to buy his business products, thus he has less profit from his enterprise and his customer list is decreasing. So he took out a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy more items, such as flour and gas, needed for his bakery business, in order to make bread and distribute it to many shops. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and open another bakery shop.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as flour and gas, needed for his bakery business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 58 years old, married, and has three children. She has a retail shop in Oloitoktok town, which she has been running for the last 10 years. This is her second loan term with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the amount she borrows to buy more goods to sell. These include bread, cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and sugar. She will use the anticipated income to buy yet more goods to sell. She hopes to expand her business and open a wholesale shop. She also hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more goods for sell in her shop.

loans.name: Irene Gissela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí vive la señora Irene, tiene 29 años  de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 6 y 1 año de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es obrero.
